fsi_base_frr_fsi_01.name: Verified Emails
fsi_base_frr_fsi_01.description: FedRAMP FSI > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
fsi_base_frr_fsi_01.instructions: FedRAMP MUST send messages to cloud service providers using an official @fedramp.gov or @gsa.gov email address with properly configured Sender Policy Framework (SPF), DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM), and Domain-based Message Authentication Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) email authentication.

fsi_base_frr_fsi_02.name: Criticality Designators
fsi_base_frr_fsi_02.description: FedRAMP FSI > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
fsi_base_frr_fsi_02.instructions: FedRAMP MUST convey the criticality of the message in the subject line using one of the following designators if the message requires an elevated response:

fsi_base_frr_fsi_03.name: Sender Addresses
fsi_base_frr_fsi_03.description: FedRAMP FSI > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
fsi_base_frr_fsi_03.instructions: FedRAMP MUST send Emergency and Emergency Test designated messages from fedramp_security@gsa.gov OR fedramp_security@fedramp.gov.

fsi_base_frr_fsi_04.name: Public Notice of Emergency Tests
fsi_base_frr_fsi_04.description: FedRAMP FSI > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
fsi_base_frr_fsi_04.instructions: FedRAMP MUST post a public notice at least 10 business days in advance of sending an Emergency Test message; such notices MUST include explanation of the _likely_ expected actions and timeframes for the Emergency Test message.

fsi_base_frr_fsi_05.name: Required Actions
fsi_base_frr_fsi_05.description: FedRAMP FSI > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
fsi_base_frr_fsi_05.instructions: FedRAMP MUST clearly specify the required actions in the body of messages that require an elevated response.

fsi_base_frr_fsi_06.name: Response Timeframes
fsi_base_frr_fsi_06.description: FedRAMP FSI > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
fsi_base_frr_fsi_06.instructions: FedRAMP MUST clearly specify the expected timeframe for completing required actions in the body of messages that require an elevated response; timeframes for actions will vary depending on the situation but the default timeframes to provide an estimated resolution time for Emergency and Emergency Test designated messages will be as follows:

fsi_base_frr_fsi_07.name: Corrective Actions
fsi_base_frr_fsi_07.description: FedRAMP FSI > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
fsi_base_frr_fsi_07.instructions: FedRAMP MUST clearly specify the corrective actions that will result from failure to complete the required actions in the body of messages that require an elevated response; such actions may vary from negative ratings in the FedRAMP Marketplace to suspension of FedRAMP authorization depending on the severity of the event.

fsi_base_frr_fsi_08.name: Response Metrics
fsi_base_frr_fsi_08.description: FedRAMP FSI > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
fsi_base_frr_fsi_08.instructions: FedRAMP MAY track and publicly share the time required by cloud service providers to take the actions specified in messages that require an elevated response.

fsi_base_frr_fsi_09.name: FedRAMP Security Inbox
fsi_base_frr_fsi_09.description: FedRAMP FSI > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
fsi_base_frr_fsi_09.instructions: Providers MUST establish and maintain an email address to receive messages from FedRAMP; this inbox is a _FedRAMP Security Inbox_ (FSI).

fsi_base_frr_fsi_10.name: Receiving Messages
fsi_base_frr_fsi_10.description: FedRAMP FSI > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
fsi_base_frr_fsi_10.instructions: Providers MUST treat any email originating from an @fedramp.gov or @gsa.gov email address as if it was sent from FedRAMP by default; if such a message is confirmed to originate from someone other than FedRAMP then _FedRAMP Security Inbox_ requirements no longer apply.

fsi_base_frr_fsi_11.name: Response
fsi_base_frr_fsi_11.description: FedRAMP FSI > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
fsi_base_frr_fsi_11.instructions: Providers MUST receive and respond to email messages from FedRAMP without disruption and without requiring additional actions from FedRAMP.

fsi_base_frr_fsi_12.name: Notification of Changes
fsi_base_frr_fsi_12.description: FedRAMP FSI > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
fsi_base_frr_fsi_12.instructions: Providers MUST immediately notify FedRAMP of any changes in addressing for their _FedRAMP Security Inbox_ by emailing info@fedramp.gov with the name and FedRAMP ID of the cloud service offering and the updated email address.

fsi_base_frr_fsi_13.name: Acknowedgement of Receipt
fsi_base_frr_fsi_13.description: FedRAMP FSI > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
fsi_base_frr_fsi_13.instructions: Providers SHOULD _promptly_ and automatically acknowledge the receipt of messages received from FedRAMP in their _FedRAMP Security Inbox_.

fsi_base_frr_fsi_14.name: Required Response for Emergency Messages
fsi_base_frr_fsi_14.description: FedRAMP FSI > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
fsi_base_frr_fsi_14.instructions: Providers MUST complete the required actions in Emergency or Emergency Test designated messages sent by FedRAMP within the timeframe included in the message.

fsi_base_frr_fsi_15.name: Routing
fsi_base_frr_fsi_15.description: FedRAMP FSI > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
fsi_base_frr_fsi_15.instructions: Providers MUST route Emergency designated messages sent by FedRAMP to a senior security official for their awareness.

fsi_base_frr_fsi_16.name: Recommended Response for Important Messages
fsi_base_frr_fsi_16.description: FedRAMP FSI > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
fsi_base_frr_fsi_16.instructions: Providers SHOULD complete the required actions in Important designated messages sent by FedRAMP within the timeframe specified in the message.
